page.title: 05Park Farm (continued)
page.content: Park Farm is now a rest home for old people, which is run by Mrs Pratt. It is about 385 years old and it has a land cover of 4 acres. It is owned by the Hampshire County Council but it was owned by the Reeve of Hampshire and was built for him by the Earl of Southampton who used it as a hunting lodge. It is priced at a hundred thousand pounds. It's surroundings are trees and grass lands and grazing lands for deer and other forest animals. The house itself is very big having twelve rooms. The house now is listed by the Department of the Environment in London as a category grade two building.In 1743 another story was added on on top.Mrs Pratt told us she found a 1753 penny in between the two stories.
